meanings.definition: Resembling or having the consistency of cheese.
meanings.sent1: The chef prepared a caseous dish that melted in my mouth.
meanings.sent2: The pizza was topped with gooey, caseous mozzarella.
meanings.sent3: The mouse found a caseous surprise in the corner of the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: The sunset painted the sky with caseous hues of orange and yellow.
meanings.sent5: The artist sculpted a caseous masterpiece out of clay.

meanings.sent1: The caseous aroma of the cheese shop filled the street.
meanings.sent2: The cheeseboard displayed an array of caseous delights.
meanings.sent3: The detective solved the caseous mystery of the missing cheese wheel.
meanings.sent4: The moon shone like a caseous wheel in the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The caseous texture of the cheese made it irresistible.

meanings.sent1: The sandwich had a caseous filling that oozed out with each bite.
meanings.sent2: The caseous sauce added a rich flavor to the pasta dish.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled as they made caseous faces with their food.
meanings.sent4: The old book had a caseous smell, like aged cheese.
meanings.sent5: The warm bread had a caseous center that was a delightful surprise.
